intro: Knautia felina, commonly known as the cat's paw, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant features showy, pink to purple flower heads that resemble a cat's paw, hence its common name. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Knautia felina is often found in meadows and along rocky slopes, thriving in well-drained soils.
